intro: Cyperus diffusus var. umbrosus, commonly known as the dark sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. Its flowering spikes are usually clustered at the top of the plant, producing small, inconspicuous flowers. Cyperus diffusus var. umbrosus is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its ability to thrive in waterlogged soils and its attractive, upright growth habit.
